headline: Mag 7 earnings, PCE data, April jobs report: What to Watch
summary: Here's what investors are watching during the week starting Monday, April 28. "Magnificent Seven" earnings will continue, with Microsoft (MSFT), Meta (META), Apple (AAPL), and Amazon (AMZN) set to release quarterly results throughout the week. The market will receive fresh economic data on Wednesday, when Personal Consumption Expenditure (PCE) data will be released, and on Friday, when the newest jobs report will be released. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. headline: Why John Chambers expects more iPhones to be made in India & US
summary: Apple (AAPL) is planning to make most of its iPhones headed for the US market in India by the end of 2026, according to a Reuters report. JC2 Ventures Founder and CEO John Chambers, who used to be Cisco's Executive Chairman and CEO, thinks that more iPhone production could move to both India and the US. In the video above, you can also hear his outlook for AI and the trade war with China. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Apple Has a Plan to Dodge Tariffs. Trump Might Not Like It.
summary: Apple  is squarely in the middle of the U.S.-China trade war—but it has a plan to avoid a sharp increase in the cost of iPhones.  It might not be to the taste of President Donald Trump.  The Trump administration has temporarily exempted smartphones, computers, and other electronic devices from the president’s threat of 145% on China imports.

headline: 2 Top Stocks You Can Buy Now With $500
summary: Wall Street's concerns over tariffs and how President Donald Trump's trade wars will impact the U.S. economy have sent the Nasdaq Composite down by around 18% year to date, and it's off more than 20% from its peak.  For less than $500, you can buy one share each of Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL).  The market sell-off has taken Amazon down to $166 per share at the time of this writing.

headline: Why Warren Buffett Isn't Likely to Buy Tesla Stock -- Ever
summary: Back on April Fools' Day, there were rumors about Warren Buffett acquiring Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) for $1 trillion and taking it over, in what would have been a stunning move for the billionaire investor.  While Tesla is a leading company in the electric vehicle (EV) market, it's simply not the type of stock I would ever expect Buffett to buy, let alone for it to take up a significant position in the Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) portfolio.  Here's why Buffett would likely never own the stock, regardless of its valuation.

raw.headline: Why Warren Buffett Isn't Likely to Buy Tesla Stock -- Ever

Here's why Buffett would likely never own the stock, regardless of its valuation.
